IKP EDEN had the pleasure of hosting Kei Iiyama and Dr. Sharath R from Sakra Hospitals. It was an insightful introductory meeting where we showcased the work IKP Knowledge Park and IKP EDEN are doing to support innovation and nurture high-impact hardware & deeptech startups

Startups like Cureous Cartosense and others had the opportunity to engage with the Sakra team and share their journeys and technologies. We also had the opportunity to walk them through our facility and the infrastructure we provide to early-stage ventures.

IKP EDEN is excited about the potential synergies and are looking forward to co-creating opportunities that can accelerate MedTech innovation and deliver scalable healthcare solutions.
Collaboration like this strengthens the ecosystemâ€”and we're just getting started!

We are constantly inspired by purpose-driven solutions that tackle critical public health challenges at the grassroots.
 
Bengaluru-based Janitri Innovations, an IKP-supported, startup quietly transforming maternal and newborn health through frugal innovation, is a powerful reminder that big change often begins with small, thoughtful steps.
 
We celebrate ventures that combine empathy and engineering to create scalable, life-saving interventions.
 
Janitri is supported by programs like AGC JanCARE, a part of our portfolio, and is incubated at IKP EDEN. As ecosystem enablers, stories like these reinforce our belief in nurturing science and technology for inclusive growth.

A big congratulations to Lamark Biotech, one of the deep science startups nurtured at IKP, for raising â‚¹6.5 crore in a pre-Series AÂ fundingÂ round led by IAN Group (formerly Indian Angel Network), including IAN Alpha Fund, powered by BioAngels,Â to advance innovation in protein-based drugs, such as insulin, monoclonal antibodies, and enzymes, for pharma and nutraceuticals.

A recipient of the Biotechnology Ignition Grant (BIG 18), Lamarkâ€™s proprietary innovation, ProteoStrong, can greatly stabilise the drug, extending its shelf life, thereby improving the accessibility and affordability of molecular medicines. 

This milestone is a testament to the power of research-driven biotech and the growing investor confidence in science-led enterprises from India.

We are proud to announce the inauguration of our R&D Centre for Intracellular Therapeutics, a space that brings our science, purpose, and people together under one roof!ğŸ‰

The event was short yet deeplyÂ meaningful, graced by the presence of the Honâ€™ble Consul General of Ireland, Ms. Anita Kelly, and her team, who toured our new facility and engaged with our scientists. We were also honored to host Mr. Rishaad Currimjee, one of our recent investors, whose support continues to drive our growth. 

At the heart of this celebration was a reflection on why we do what we do. As shared by our Founder & CEO, Dr. Nusrat Sanghamitra, this journey began with a deeply personal mission: to make cancer treatments safer and less toxic. From a PhD bench at IISc to pioneering intracellular drug delivery solutions, that vision has evolved into GEENIE, our proprietary platform to overcome the bottlenecks of modern drug development. 

Our heartfelt thanks to the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) BIG Grant and KIIT-Technology Business Incubator for their early support, which helped lay the foundation of our journey. We did not miss remembering all our esteemed investors,Â partners,Â and well-wishers for their warm wishes for the occasion Â unwavering supportÂ ofÂ ourÂ journeyÂ and belief in our vision, which has been instrumental in keepingÂ us motivated continuously.  

Behind every experiment is a human story. Behind every breakthrough, a relentless team. This new center is more than just a lab. Itâ€™s a symbol of our commitment to transforming lives, molecule by molecule.Â 
Â 
We're just getting started.Â 
Â

We extend our deepest gratitude to BIRAC-FIRST Hub for their steadfast support of Indiaâ€™s biotech innovation ecosystem. As a facilitation unit addressing everything from regulatory navigation and funding to intellectual property and market access, FIRST Hub plays a critical role in helping startups grow with confidence.

At Serigen, we are especially grateful for the regulatory clarity and mentorship we've received from BIRAC-FIRST Hub. With their support, weâ€™ve been able to accelerate our journey through approvals and ensure compliance, allowing us to focus on what matters most: delivering high-quality tissue engineering solutions to patients.

IT BT Department, Karnataka, Sujith J Chandy, Ex. Dir., ICARS, Dr. Lata Kapoor, Addl. Dir. National Centre for Disease Control, Kamini Walia, Head, Research Division Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), and Prof. LS SHASHIDHARA, Dir National Centre for Biological Sciences

Dinesh Gundu Rao,  Priyank M Kharge, Department of Biotechnology, India DST, World Health Organization, Global Antibiotic R&D Partnership (GARDP), Gates Foundation India, Gates Foundation, Wellcome Trust, Innovation Centre Denmark, Innovation Centre Denmark Bangalore,  Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC), DBT BIRAC

C-CAMP today hosted the India AMR Innovation Workshop under the India AMR Innovation Hub (#IAIH), with strategic guidance from Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India. 

Top stakeholders from across the AMR ecosystem came together to discuss, deliberate and roadmap Indiaâ€™s AMR priorities. We also featured an exclusive showcase of the technologies supported under IAIH.

In his inaugural talk, Prof. Ajay Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Govt of India and Chair of the C-CAMP-anchored #IAIH.â€œAt this crucial juncture, as India prepares its National Action Plan 2.0 on AMR, such workshops will provide insights and help frame better policies.â€ He emphasised on the power of national and international collaboration in addressing the multidimensional challenges of AMR.

Dr. Ekroop Caur, IAS, Secy. IT BT Department, Karnataka, in her address noted: â€œAMR is not just a public health crisis; it poses a significant threat to economic development and societal growth at large. Our recently unveiled Biotech Policy identifies AMR as a key focus area for intervention, reflecting the Government of Karnatakaâ€™s commitment to addressing this challenge through innovation and collaboration." She also added, "We need a collective, coordinated effort to tackle AMR, and what I see here today through the India AMR Innovation Hub is a promising start â€” many stakeholders coming together in one room, collaborating to address a shared challenge."

CCAMP Dir- CEO Dr Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD added, â€œWe are delighted to host this first-of-a-kind workshop under the India AMR Innovation Hub umbrella chaired by Prof. Sood, PSA, which aims to convene a robust national network of stakeholders, including researchers, innovators, policymakers, healthcare providers, and industry leaders working in cross sectoral AMR domain. We look forward to working together to foster solutions for AMR by leveraging cutting-edge research and contribute to policy making at the Central and State levels to combat this huge global threat.â€
........
Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD Dr Jitendra Singh, ICMR,
